gameFiles

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameFiles.Ball

  • public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
    The bouncing ball. This is the main object in the game. The intersects methods and update method were coded by Hock-Chuan Chua. They have been modified to fit the program. The Constructors, access methods and methods that change the velocity of the ball were coded by Mike. The code is a mixture of two programs modified to fit together.
    Version:
    v4.0 June 12th, 2014
    Author:
    Mike aka Wilkystyles, Hock-Chuan Chua, Jason P'ng

      • intersect

        public void intersect(ButtonObstacle button,
                      float timeLimit)
        Check if the ball collides with the given ButtonObstacle within the time interval.
        Written by Hock-Chuan Chau modified by Jason P'ng
        If statement checks if the collision is earlier than the current earliest collision.
        Parameters:
        ButtonObstacle - button the obstacle being checked
        float - timeLimit the amount of time being checked for

      • intersect

        public void intersect(ObstacleLine lineSegment,
                      float timeLimit)
        Check if this ball collides with the given BlockLineSegment in the interval (0, timeLimit]. A line segment has two definite end-points.
        Written by Hock-Chuan Chau modified by Jason P'ng
        If statement checks if the collision is earlier than the current earliest collision.
        nested if statement checks for a type of lineSegment to add an effect.
        Parameters:
        lineSegment: - the line-shape obstacle.
        timeLimit: - upperbound of the time interval.

      • update

        public void update(float time)
        Update the states of this ball for the given time, where time <= 1.

        Written by Hock-Chuan Chau modified by Jason P'ng
        if (pseudoPaddleHit == true) - Checks if the padde was hit to apply a fixed velocity
        Nested if apply the appropriate velocity up or down according the the balls previous velocity.
        if (earliestCollisionResponse.t <= time) - Checks if the collision is within the time limit. Otherwise, move on.

        Parameters:
        time: - the earliest collision time detected in the system. If this ball's earliestCollisionResponse.time equals to time, this ball is the one that collided; otherwise, there is a collision elsewhere.
